about_the_game:
SD Dungeons Trial Version

In addition to character creation for SD Dungeons, you can experience part of the adventure!
Available jobs are as follows...

■Fighter
A melee fighter who uses a sword and shield.
Average offensive and defensive strength, easy to handle.
Use non-habitual attacks and counters to your advantage!

■Ranger
A long-range fighter who uses a bow.
Low defense, but has the best range!
Use your spacing to attack unilaterally!

■Sorcerer
A long-range staff wielder.
Like rangers, they have low defense, but they can use powerful magic!
The performance of magic changes as it is recharged!


As for adventures, the quest mode is 1-1 to 1-4,
Dungeon mode can be played up to beginner level.

SD Dungeons Trial Version

In addition to character creation for SD Dungeons, you can experience part of the adventure!
Available jobs are as follows...

■Fighter
A melee fighter who uses a sword and shield.
Average offensive and defensive strength, easy to handle.
Use non-habitual attacks and counters to your advantage!

■Ranger
A long-range fighter who uses a bow.
Low defense, but has the best range!
Use your spacing to attack unilaterally!

■Sorcerer
A long-range staff wielder.
Like rangers, they have low defense, but they can use powerful magic!
The performance of magic changes as it is recharged!


As for adventures, the quest mode is 1-1 to 1-4,
Dungeon mode can be played up to beginner level.
name: SD Dungeons Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 (64-Bit)
  • Processor: intel core-i5-4000
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForece GTX960
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Controller recommended
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 (64-Bit)
  • Processor: intel core-i7-4720
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050ti
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Controller recommended

short_description: Create your own character and go on a great adventure! Randomly generated dungeons at each level and gates that affect the difficulty of where you go await you! Can you get powerful weapons and gems and escape without running out of power?
